name: Analyze and Extract Research Insights and Gaps from Scientific Papers
definition: This capability accepts input in various formats, including text with embedded paper identifiers, JSON objects, or attached PDFs representing academic research papers. It retrieves and processes the relevant papers, then performs a comprehensive analysis that includes detailed summarization, extraction of potential research ideas, experimental directions, emerging trends, and identification of research gaps. The results are provided in a structured format, such as Markdown or JSON, to facilitate further academic inquiry.
alias: Extract and analyze ArXiv papers from text

name: Automate browser tasks
definition: This capability allows the agent to control a headless browser for web automation. It can navigate web pages, perform searches, click elements, extract web content, automate form filling, and take screenshots.

name: Browse web
definition: This capability enables an agent to browse the web to answer questions. It processes user queries by searching online for up-to-date information and returning relevant results, such as weather updates or topic-specific data.

name: Collect academic signals
definition: Acquires academic data and signals based on specified dates or research queries to initiate the signal processing workflow.

name: Convert Mermaid code
definition: Convert provided Mermaid code into a visual diagram image, such as an SVG. The capability accepts Mermaid code as input and returns a rendered image of the diagram.

name: Download Paper PDFs with ID Extraction
definition: This capability accepts input in various formats, such as JSON objects containing ArXiv IDs or natural language text that may include one or more ArXiv IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from the input and downloads the corresponding PDF files for each ID. Each PDF is then encoded into a Base64 string, and the capability returns a JSON list of these encoded strings.
alias: Extract IDs and download paper PDFs

name: Edit and transform text
definition: This capability empowers the agent to perform structured text editing and transformation, including find-and-replace operations, templating, formatting, and content modifications according to specified patterns or guidelines.

name: Execute Python code
definition: This capability enables the agent to run arbitrary Python code snippets in a secure sandbox environment. It processes the code to produce standard output, generate visual plots, handle errors, and integrate the results back into the conversation.

name: Generate Mermaid diagram
definition: Generate Mermaid code for various diagram types such as flowcharts, sequence diagrams, and class diagrams based on input descriptions. The capability accepts a diagram specification as input and returns the corresponding Mermaid code.

name: Generate academic report
definition: Compiles and structures the outcomes of the signal processing workflow into a comprehensive academic report summarizing findings and recommendations.

name: Greeting and Help
definition: Handles greetings and inquiries by providing information about the agent's capabilities, available functions, and guidelines for effective usage.

name: Integrate MCP tools
definition: This capability enables the agent to dynamically connect to remote MCP servers via SSE or stdio. It discovers, invokes, and refreshes remote tool schemas on-the-fly, allowing the integration of external service tools as if they were local.

name: Interpret academic signals
definition: Analyzes and deciphers collected academic signals to extract meaningful insights and trends from the data.

name: Iterative Prompt Optimization
definition: This capability encompasses both initial and iterative refinement of prompts to improve clarity, effectiveness, and consistency. It continuously incorporates feedback and additional context to enhance the prompt's performance, ensuring that user instructions provide a robust operational framework to guide AI responses.

name: Manage Long-Running Tasks
definition: This capability encompasses the creation, monitoring, and control of long-running tasks throughout their lifecycle. It includes initiating tasks, real-time progress tracking, multi-step execution monitoring, generating output artifacts in various formats (e.g., Markdown, HTML, images), and supporting task cancellation.

name: Process File Uploads
definition: Receive file uploads by extracting key metadata such as file name, type, and size. Acknowledge and summarize the file's details, and facilitate further processing of the document if required.

name: Provide Conversational Assistance
definition: Engage in natural language text-based conversations using conversational AI and large language models to process queries, answer questions, provide clear explanations, generate summaries, and handle multi-turn dialogue for clarifying and communicating complex topics.

name: Recommend and Filter Academic Content
definition: Accepts input in various formats — such as natural language text containing ArXiv paper IDs or a list of IDs — and extracts valid academic identifiers. It retrieves full metadata for the identified papers and applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and ranking based on provided instructions or internal logic. The capability outputs a ranked list of recommended academic papers or research topics to support scholarly inquiry.

name: Respond to Gaia task
definition: Handle Gaia-related queries and tasks by generating appropriate responses based on Gaia task instructions.

name: Review Academic Paper
definition: Reviews an academic paper either provided directly as a PDF file or via a URL from which the PDF is downloaded. The capability extracts text and metadata, analyzes the content, and generates a comprehensive review report with structured scoring (for example, on a scale of 1-10) for methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance.

name: Search Academic Papers
definition: This capability accepts a natural language query or a structured JSON query to search academic papers across one or more databases such as arXiv and Semantic Scholar. It processes the input query, executes searches on the specified academic databases, and returns a numbered list (up to 5 results) where each entry includes key metadata such as the paper title, authors with publication year, source identifier, a truncated abstract, and available PDF URLs.

name: Terminate Tasks with Cleanup
definition: This capability allows for the graceful termination of multi-step tasks by issuing a cancellation command that not only stops the ongoing process but also ensures that associated resources (such as browser instances or MCP connections) are properly released and that a final success or error status is reported. It effectively combines task cancellation with resource cleanup.

name: Validate Mermaid syntax
definition: Verify the correctness of Mermaid code by checking its syntax. The capability accepts Mermaid code as input and returns a validation result indicating whether the syntax is correct or provides error details.
